document_data.name: Vale of Lost Voices
document_data.mainbody: The '''Vale of Lost Voices''' was a sacred burial place for honored [[elf]] warriors located in [[Cormanthor]].
document_data.Geography: [[Rauthauvyr's Road]] passed though the middle of the Vale, and while travelers were not disturbed if they stuck to the road, any attempt to interfere with the tombs and mausoleums usually ended poorly for the [[adventurer]].
document_data.History:
Created on the spot where [[Venom]] ambushed and killed those who had killed his mate, the Vale of Lost Voices was guarded as of the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] by [[baelnorn]]s from the [[sylvan elf]] clan [[Audark]]. Over time, the place had been used by other elves to bury their honored dead. 

A guardian of the Vale was a grumpy, if not insane, old dwarf named [[Durkin]]. He lived in an abandoned elvish castle on a rocky tor in the Vale.

Cormanthor's [[drow]] gave the Vale a wide berth.

The [[Eldreth Veluuthra]] considered the Vale to be a sacred place.
